summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Sixty-fourth Street, in the City of Seattle, from Eighth Avenue Northwest to a point three hundred (300) feet west of the west margin of Fifteenth Avenue Northwest, by constructing sewers therein of proper dimensions and materials, together with all wyes, manholes, catch basins, flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewering and draining of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1047 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
